etymologies: late Middle English: from Old French lesard(e), from Latin lacertus ‘lizard, sea fish’, also ‘muscle’

definitions: a reptile that typically has a long body and tail, four legs, movable eyelids, and a rough, scaly, or spiny skin.

notes.text: Suborder Lacertilia (or Sauria), order Squamata: many families

shortDefinitions: reptile that has long body and tail and four legs
